title: Jordan Peterson/Lawrence Krauss Conversation Sends Us on a Journey to the Bleeding Edge of Physics
description:
A physicist and mathematician, Glen offers some deeper insights into the ground covered by Lawrence Krauss in his conversation with Jordan Peterson. We tackle quantum weirdness, the free will of electrons and the disappearance of time and space at the quantum level.
Takes us a few minutes to get underway due to some sound issues, but I promise you, it's worth the journey.

Jordan Peterson/Lawrence Krauss video from 1:20:10 to 1:22:50
https://youtu.be/SF_SwujfiYk?t=4810

Physicist Nima Arkani Hamed's talk at Cornell University on the Morality of Fundamental Physics:  https://youtu.be/5aAMJNVmdoY

Quasi-particles: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quasiparticle

Macroscopic Quantum Entanglement: https://physicstoday.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/PT.3.4789

Metronomes spontaneously synchronize: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T58lGKREubo

Quantum Eraser: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ORLN_KwAgs

“A Delayed Choice Quantum Eraser,” Yoon-Ho Kim, R. Yu, S.P. Kulik, and Y.H. Shih: https://arxiv.org/pdf/quant-ph/9903047.pdf

“Do Electrons Have Free Will? The Conway-Kochen Free Will Theorem - Closing the Free Will Loophole,”  https://youtu.be/7ZqUEAACfyk
